cmd.name: gettype
cmd.doc: Returns the datatype the variable is set to. If void is returned the variable is empty.

cmd.name: geti
cmd.doc: Returns the content of the variable if it is an int variable. If it's not an int variable, 0 is returned and an error message is printed.

cmd.name: getf
cmd.doc: Returns the content of the variable if it is a float variable. If it's not a float variable, 0.0 is returned and an error message is printed.

cmd.name: getb
cmd.doc: Returns the content of the variable if it is a bool variable. If it's not a bool, false is returned and an error message is printed.

cmd.name: gets
cmd.doc: Returns the content of the variable if it is a string variable. If it's not a string variable, "" is returned and an error message is printed.

cmd.name: geto
cmd.doc: Returns the content of the variable as an object handle. If it's not an object handle, NULL is returned and an error message is printed.

cmd.name: seti
cmd.doc: Sets the content of the variable to the passed integer value.

cmd.name: setf
cmd.doc: Sets the content of the variable to the passed float value.

cmd.name: setb
cmd.doc: Sets the content of the variable to the passed boolean value.

cmd.name: sets
cmd.doc: Sets the content of the variable to the passed string.

cmd.name: seto
cmd.doc: Sets the content of the variable to the passed object handle.

cmd.name: setf4
cmd.doc: Sets the content of the variable to a 4D vector.

cmd.name: open
cmd.doc: Open a file. Filename can be a Nebula filename using path assigns. AccessMode is a string containing an "r" for read-mode, and/or "w" for write-mode.

cmd.name: puts
cmd.doc: Put a string into the file.

cmd.name: setassign
cmd.doc: Defines an assign with the specified name and links it to the specified path.

cmd.name: setassigngroup2
cmd.doc: Defines an assign with the specified name and links it to the specified path group.

cmd.name: getassign
cmd.doc: Get a path associated with an assign.

cmd.name: getassigngroup
cmd.doc: Get a path list associated with an assign group.

cmd.name: getallmanglepath
cmd.doc: Get a all manglepath path list associated with an assign group.

cmd.name: manglepath
cmd.doc: Convert a path with assigns into a native absolute path.

cmd.name: manglepath2
cmd.doc: Convert a path with assigns into a native absolute path. Use read = true for read path resolution, and read = false for write path resolution.

cmd.name: fileexists
cmd.doc: Return true if file exists. Note: does not work for directories!

cmd.name: createfilenode
cmd.doc: Create a Nebula2 filenode and return it. A filenode wraps a nFile object into a nRoot node, and offers a script interface. Use a nfilenode object for file access from within MicroTcl, or other script functions which don't have their own file access functions.

cmd.name: makepath
cmd.doc: Create a path. Return true if directory is created.
Get a list with all the classes that inherit from the given class. Only one level of inheritance is searched, so a class is returned only if its immediate superclass is the given class.

cmd.name: getwarninglevel
cmd.doc: return the maximun of warning level

cmd.name: setwarninglevel
cmd.doc: set the warning level of this log

cmd.name: setlogenable
cmd.doc: return if this log is enable

cmd.name: getlogenable
cmd.doc: return if this log is enable

cmd.name: getlastlogs
cmd.doc: Return a list of all the log entries in the log buffer. The log buffer is cleared afterwards.

cmd.name: enableloggroup
cmd.doc: Enable the masked log groups in the named log class.

cmd.name: enableloggroupbyindex
cmd.doc: Enable the log group in the named log class.

cmd.name: disableloggroup
cmd.doc: Disable the masked log groups in the named log class.

cmd.name: disableloggroupbyindex
cmd.doc: Disable the log group in the named log class.

cmd.name: getenabledloggroups
cmd.doc: Return the mask for the enabled log groups in the named log class.

cmd.name: getgroupname
cmd.doc: Return the name of the group for the masked group in the named log class.

cmd.name: getnumgroups
cmd.doc: Return the number of groups in the named log class.
Save the object under a given name into a file.

Creates a clone of this object. - If the object's class hierarchy doesn't contain nroot then 'CloneName' is ignored. Otherwise 'CloneName' is the name given to the new cloned object. - If the original object has child objects, they will be cloned as well.
Save object state for later restoring on an already created object.
Load object state replacing the current state.
Return current ref count of object.
Return name of class which the object is an instance of.
Return the list of classes which the object is an instance of.
Check whether the object is instantiated or derived from the class given by 'Classname'.
Check whether the object is an instance of the class given by 'Classname'.
Return a list of all script command prototypes the object accepts.
Get byte size of this object. This may or may not accurate, depending on whether the object uses external allocated memory, and if the object's class takes this into account.
set a dependency with a nRoot object saved in a persistent file
set a dependency with a nObject object saved in a persistent file
Check if object has a specific command.
Check if object must be dipslayed in editor tools.
Make this object displayable in editor
Make this object not displayable in editor

cmd.name: hasscommand
cmd.doc: Check if object has a specific command.

cmd.name: setsavelevel
cmd.doc: Set the save level which filters commands to be saved. The default save level of 0 will let all commands through, a save level of 1 will only let commands with a level of 1 or greater through.

cmd.name: setsaverclass
cmd.doc: Set name of nScriptServer derived class which should be used for saving objects.

cmd.name: getsaverclass
cmd.doc: Get class name of saver nScriptServer.

cmd.name: setsavetype
cmd.doc: Set the save type which specifies the type of information to save. This might be consulted checked by the SaveCmds in order to know what kind of commands to save.

cmd.name: save
cmd.doc: Save the object under its current name into a filesystem file. The filename will be 'name_of_object.n'. Such a persistent object file must be read back with the nsh 'get' command.

cmd.name: getparent
cmd.doc: Return the full pathname of the parent object. If the object doesn't have a parent object (this is only valid for the root object '/'), 'null' will be returned.

cmd.name: gethead
cmd.doc: Return full pathname of first child object, or 'null' if no child objects exist.

cmd.name: gettail
cmd.doc: Return full pathname of last child object, or 'null' if no child objects exist.

cmd.name: getsucc
cmd.doc: Return full pathname of next object in the same hierarchy level, zero if no next object exists.

cmd.name: getpred
cmd.doc: Return full pathname of previous object in the same hierarchy level, zero if no previous object exists.

cmd.name: getchildren
cmd.doc: Return a list of all children.

cmd.name: setname
cmd.doc: Give the object a new name ('Name' may not contain any path components!).

cmd.name: getname
cmd.doc: Return the object's name without path.

cmd.name: getfullname
cmd.doc: Return the full pathname of the object.

cmd.name: getrelpath
cmd.doc: Return the shortest relative path leading from this object to the given object.

cmd.name: find
cmd.doc: Find a child object with name 'Name'. Return full path of child if found, or 'null' if not found.

cmd.name: gettreesize
cmd.doc: This is the recursive version of getinstancesize.

cmd.name: binddirtydependence
cmd.doc: Create a dependency link between me and the passed object.

cmd.name: txtoutput
cmd.doc: Retrieves the last txt output of a command.

cmd.name: getattrib

cmd.name: appendfile

cmd.name: hasparam

cmd.name: removeparam

cmd.name: beginlevel

cmd.name: setbasedirectory

cmd.name: getbasedirectory
cmd.doc: Get the base directory for capturing.

cmd.name: setframetime
cmd.doc: Set the locked frame time for capturing. Default is 1/25.

cmd.name: getframetime
cmd.doc: Get the locked frame time for capturing.
Set a new display mode. This must happen outside opendisplay/closedisplay.
Get the feature set implemented by the graphics card.
Save a screenshot to the provided filename. A 24 bpp BMP file will be created.
Define the scissor rectangle (topleft is (0.0f, 0.0f), bottomright is (1.0f, 1.0f)). Note that scissoring must be enabled externally in a shader!
Set whether no cursor, a standard or a custom mouse cursor will be displayed.
Sets the window's icon. This must happen outside opendisplay/closedisplay.
Set gamma value (adjustgamma must be called for the change to take effect)
Get current gamma value (reflects the last call to setgamma, which may not correspond to the actual screen gamma if adjustgamma has not been called).
Set brightness value (adjustgamma must be called for the change to take effect)
Get current brightness (reflects last call to setbrightness, which may not correspond to the actual screen brightness if adjustgamma has not been called).
Set contrast value (adjustgamma must be called for the change to take effect)
Get current contrast (reflects last call to setcontrast, which may not correspond to the actual screen contrast if adjustgamma has not been called).
Commits the last gamma, contrast, and brightness values set, so that they are actually visible on the screen. 23-Aug-04 kims created
Resets screen gamma to default values.
Set whether or not the window handler should skip its message loop. This is required when embedding Nebula into an application that provides its own event loop, such as using wxWidgets.

cmd.name: setcompanyname

cmd.name: getcompanyname

cmd.name: open

cmd.name: keyexists

cmd.name: getresourcebytesize

cmd.name: playfile

cmd.name: setsubdivnum
cmd.doc: Defines the maximum allowed number of elements in an octree node before it will be subdivided and its elements spread over the new subcubes. Default: 4

cmd.name: setvisualize
cmd.doc: Switches the visualize-mode of the octrees on/off. That means lines are drawn to visualize the normaly invisible octree cubes.

cmd.name: getvisualize
cmd.doc: Queries the actual value of the visualize-flag.

cmd.name: collect
cmd.doc: Determines the number of objects inside the provided culling area.

getter.doc: Get the particle emission frequency curve.

setter.name: setemissionfrequency
setter.doc: Set the particle emission frequency curve.

getter.name: getparticlelifetime
getter.doc: Get the particle life time curve.

setter.name: setparticlelifetime
setter.doc: Set the particle life time curve.

property.name: StartVelocity
property.doc: The particle start velocity curve. This is the velocity that will be set to the particle when it is going to be emitted.

getter.name: getparticlestartvelocity
getter.doc: Get the particle start velocity curve.

setter.name: setparticlestartvelocity
setter.doc: Set the particle start velocity curve.

property.name: RotationVelocity
property.doc: The particle rotation velocity curve. This sets the amount of rotation for the particle over time, it is not the initial start-rotation-angle!

getter.name: getparticlerotationvelocity
getter.doc: Get the particle rotation velocity curve.

setter.name: setparticlerotationvelocity
setter.doc: Set the particle rotation velocity curve.

property.name: particleScale
property.doc: The particle scale curve. Allows you to set the size of the sprites, you can change the value over time.

property.name: particleWeight
property.doc: The particle weight. Allows you to set the weight of the particle, so you can control whether a particle is moving up or down. You can change the value over time. But remember: The weight that you set up is not an initial start-value for the particle that is beeing emitted that time! The value will change the weight for all particles, means also the particles that are already emitted!

property.name: particleRGB
property.doc: The particle rgb curve. Here you can specify overlay-colors for the image-file. The values can be set in the color-bar an can be changed over time.

property.name: particleAlpha
property.doc: the particle alpha curve. Allows you to set the alpha of the sprites, you can change the value over time.

cmd.doc: Reset the effect to run from its initial state. If the effect has been deactivated, it must be reactivated for the reset to have any visible effect.

cmd.name: seteffectactive
cmd.doc: Turns the effect on or off. This is different from turning the node on and off! An effect that is deactivated doesn't disappear immediately: no new particles are created, but already living particles are allowed to die off naturally. Conversely, an effect that is active may not do anything visible -- for example, a one-shot whose time has expired.
